title: Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition
notes: Entirely playable; runs very smoothly for most areas, but there are some areas that see noticeable FPS drops. Toggling vsync on/off when that happens seems to help. I haven't finished the whole game yet; I've gotten to the Moon Grotto. Be warned that the loading screen at the beginning is very choppy, but it recovers fully when the main menu loads. In i3wm, turning fullscreen on in-game, and then switching workspaces crashes the game; I run it windowed, and set fullscreen through i3wm, which works flawlessly (this seems to be a fairly common issue/workaround with wine/proton games on i3wm).

title: Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.0-1-amd64, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Crashes by default, runs well with either PROTON_USE_WINED3D11 or PROTON_NO_D3D11. The latter seems to give better performance (200+fps vs 100+).

title: Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) UHD Graphics 620 (Kabylake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes:
Screen looks normal until I attack.
When I attack, everything is black except for some glowing stuff and their surroundings. Border between visible and black is chunky like large pixels.

Tried "Disable D3d11" and "Use Wine D3d11", didn't fix the weird graphical glitches.


Entire screen would also turn black occasionally.

notes: Achievements aren't working flawlessly. Sometimes they just don't register. Sometimes they do.

title: Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition

notes: Played for 20 minutes from start to when you get to the tree and receive the 3 main objectives. Works flawlessly at 60fps. The only problem i saw was during first launch when the initial loading of the game took long and had massive fps drop in menu. Everything was perfect after that thou. Tested on Mouse and keyboard. Tried to use controller but it is abysmal trying to figure out how to connect my xbox controller to linux OS.
title: Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition

notes:
Works mostly fine, and is very playable @1440. Crashes sometimes when reloading to last save point after dying. Crashes sometimes with no explanation and game exits. Not all Achievements registering. Did use launch option "-force-d3d9" to get it to boot, otherwise it wouldnt load. As others have mentioned, loading screen is choppy.

Have finished the game on normal using these settings.
title: Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition

notes: I had to force dx11 mode for the  xbox controller to work
